java.io.Serializable, Relay, Relay.Target, SimpleRelay, UniqueObject
public final class SimpleRelayTarget
extends SimpleRelayBase
implements Relay.Target

Target-side implementation of SimpleRelay, constructed by the SimpleRelaySource.

for implementation notes, Serialized Form

Method Detail

setQuery

public void setQuery(java.lang.Object reply)
Description copied from interface: SimpleRelay
Change the query, which is optional.

Only the agent who's address matches "getSource()" may call this method, which must be followed by a blackboard "publishChange" to resend the query to the target.

Note that the relay implementation may batch changes and only send the latest change.

Specified by:
setQuery in interface SimpleRelay
Overrides:
setQuery in class SimpleRelayBase
Parameters:
reply - the immutable query object

getResponse

public java.lang.Object getResponse()
Description copied from interface: Relay.Target
Get the current Response for this target. Null indicates that this target has no response.

Specified by:
getResponse in interface Relay.Target

updateContent

public int updateContent(java.lang.Object content,
                         Relay.Token token)
Description copied from interface: Relay.Target
Update the target with the new content.

Specified by:
updateContent in interface Relay.Target
Returns:
NO_CHANGE if the update caused no change to the target
RESPONSE_CHANGED if the update has changed the response to be sent to the source.
CONTENT_CHANGED if the update has changed the content of the target
RESPONSE_CHANGED|CONTENT_CHANGED if both changes occurred
